department.dept_long_name: Department of Germanic Languages and Literatures

course.title: Advanced Grammar and Reading
course.description: Advanced instruction in German through systematic study of the rules of grammar, their nuances, and their exceptions. Application of this knowledge through readings of short selections of sophisticated texts (Goethe, Kant, Kleist, Heine, Marx, Nietzsche, Kafka, Mann) prepares students for courses and other work requiring advanced German reading comprehension. This course is prerequisite to advanced German speaking and writing, which students can then pursue in German 62.
course.prerequisites: German C, equivalent preparation, or permission of the instructor.
course.notes: Conducted in German. Not open to auditors.
